image.altText: A Hmong man and woman in wide-brimmed hats harvest from a row of kale with bushland behind them

props.synopsis: From a war-torn childhood in Laos, Dee Thao found her place in Tasmania as a market gardener. While she followed in her parents' footsteps, her children don't feel the same pull to continue the Hmong farming tradition.

title.children: Tasmanian Hmong children not carrying on family's farming tradition

image.altText: a replica tall ship sailing the River Derwent

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian replica tall ship, based on a 1800s ship pivotal to Hobart's colonial settlement, set sail with an all-female crew to celebrate this weekend's International Women's Day.

title.children: Pirates looted the Lady Nelson, her replica sails on, crewed by women

image.altText: A blurry still shot of a white glowing ball in a partly cloudy night sky with an orange tail burning behind it.

props.synopsis: Dozens of people have reported what is believed to be burning space junk moving across southern Australian skies on Saturday night.

title.children: Meteor group 'flooded' with reports of space junk over Tasmania, southern skies

image.altText: a fledgling orange bellied parrot held by two pairs of gloved hands

props.synopsis: Almost 30 of the critically endangered birds have been released from captivity, buoying expectations for a record-breaking winter migration this year.

title.children: 'Another record' expected as more captive-bred orange-bellied parrots released

image.altText: A supermarket vacuum package of Huon Aquaculture roasted salmon

props.synopsis: A video released earlier this week of live and dead salmon being sealed into tubs has led to a leading animal welfare suspending its certification.

title.children: RSPCA suspends Huon Aquaculture certification over live fish disposal

image.altText: Man with goggles on, vacuum blowing cold air on face toward tattoo of spider on left cheek

props.synopsis: Almost all of Adam's tattoos are "backyard jobs" done at home or in prison. A collaboration between a not-for-profit and tattoo removalist is giving him a chance to move forward without them.

title.children: Face tattoo removal offers new start after years of regret

image.altText: A man shoveling away sand

props.synopsis: Communities in the southern Gold Coast and Northern Rivers cope with the backwash of ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred but say it's not a bad outcome compared to past disasters.

title.children: Alfred-hit communities assess the damage, even as more threats loom

image.altText: local business owners in lismore pack a wheelbarrow full of produce

props.synopsis: More than 140 warnings remained in place in northern NSW late on Sunday night, while evacuation orders were lifted for the Lismore CBD, Murwillumbah and Mullumbimby.

title.children: Schools remain closed in northern NSW as residents cautiously return home

image.altText: A tall white and black building that says 'The Star' at the top, with tall palm trees in the foreground against blue sky

props.synopsis: Casino operator Star Entertainment is mulling a bid from US gaming giant Bally's, that would give it at least $250 million in funding, in exchange for a controlling stake in the group.

title.children: Star receives last-minute $250 million offer from US giant Bally's

image.altText: On an exhibition floor a man stands in front of a display of machine guns and rifles. A sign above says Thales.

props.synopsis: The national symbol for Australia's fallen soldiers has taken large sums of money from weapons makers, a move former staff call "inappropriate".

title.children: Critics slam weapons makers' war memorial funding as 'disgusting'

image.altText: Water gushing down a hill.

props.synopsis: Multiple emergency alerts are in place across Queensland as large bursts of rain and severe thunderstorms continue across the state's south-east and northern New South Wales.

title.children: Record number of calls for help to the SES

image.altText: Dave Hughes

props.synopsis: Dave Hughes based his comedy career on the embarrassing moments of his life. Now he's ready to talk about the terrifying ones.

title.children: When Dave Hughes gave up alcohol, he swapped one problem for another

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at a press conference, in front of the Israeli and American flags.

props.synopsis: Israel's energy minister declared the country would cut off electricity supplies to Gaza, effective immediately, one week after all aid deliveries were halted.

title.children: Israel cuts off power supplies to Gaza ahead of ceasefire talks

image.altText: Trump rests his fingertips together at his desk in the Oval Office

props.synopsis: What's most important for Australia — and the entire Western world — is that America has fallen to anti-globalists, and they are carrying out a deep regime change in the style of an autocratic takeover.

title.children: America's future hinges on one important question

image.altText: Men in Chinese military uniforms march

props.synopsis: Taiwan is a potential flashpoint for a war between China and the United States, which is the island's most important backer and biggest arms supplier.

title.children: Beijing warns it will tighten 'noose' around Taiwan over separatism

image.altText: A man in a beanie smiles at the camera, holding a large fish

props.synopsis: A court has heard the former NSW police officer described himself online as a "dirty paedo dad" and was prepared to pay for "underage fantasy and kink".

title.children: Former police officer requested porn with girls 'as young as possible'

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A man wearing police uniform speaking in a press briefing room.

props.synopsis: Union leaders and legal experts say there is now a '"question mark" over the appointment of dozens of senior NT Police officers, including the force's new acting commissioner.

title.children: Dozens of top NT brass appointments under scrutiny after ICAC scandal

image.altText: Black and white image of a young man in a hat cuddling with a dog on a wicker chair

props.synopsis: The youngest son of Prince Robert of Luxembourg and Princess Julie of Nassau died in Paris from PolG mitochondrial disease, his father says.

title.children: Luxembourg's Prince Frederik dies at 22 from rare genetic condition

image.altText: Yellow and blue for lease sign with red leased sticker over

props.synopsis: Rising rental prices in the West Australian town of Broome are forcing residents to take drastic measures and driving some out of town.

title.children: Broome residents forced to rethink as median rental price hits $1,000 a week

image.altText: An exterior shot of a building with the Suncorp logo

props.synopsis: The Australian share market bounces back after Wall Street ended the week a little higher, while insurance stocks climb after ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred was downgraded. Follow live.

title.children: Insurance stocks rise after cyclone downgrade, ASX bounces back

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Share price gains for insurers Suncorp, IAG and QBE
ASX ends higher, records first positive finish in a week
Deflation concerns return to China's economy

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, in a black suit, at a press conference, with a soldier admiral behind him in uniform.

props.synopsis: There is a startling new figure that will make Anthony Albanese and his Labor team very nervous going into this pre-election season.

title.children: Survey about how we see the future should worry politicians

image.altText: Woman in rain jacket standing in middle of street

props.synopsis: Murwillumbah is breathing a sigh of relief after dodging the worst of ex-Tropical Cyclone Alfred. But with more rain forecast for coming days, authorities are warning the danger isn't over yet.

title.children: Northern Rivers communities reckon with floods after dodging Alfred

props.synopsis: Former central banker Mark Carney has won the race to become leader of Canada's ruling Liberal Party and will succeed Justin Trudeau as prime minister.

title.children: Trudeau successor as Canada PM revealed, takes swipe at Trump

image.altText: A military tank with two members of the Reinforcement Syrian security forces on it in the streets of Latakia, Syria.

props.synopsis: Syria’s interim president has told worshippers at a mosque in Damascus “national unity and civil peace” must be maintained, as the death toll reportedly exceeds 1,000.

title.children: Syrian leader pleads for peace amid worst violence since fall of Assad

image.altText: Swans fans wave red and white flags at a Sydney game at the SCG

props.synopsis: The AFL's Opening Round is pitched as a way to celebrate and evolve a truly national competition, but there is really only one winner from this increasingly unpopular weekend — the AFL itself.

title.children: The AFL, 'Vic bias' and the flawed logic behind Opening Round

image.altText: Marcus Smith celebrates

props.synopsis: The 2025 Six Nations will go down to the wire as players across the British Isles continue to put up their hands to tour Australia in the winter, while a former Balmain Tiger said he'd swim Down Under if he gets the chance to tour.

title.children: Lions watch: Two Smiths, a handful of Scots and a former Balmain Tiger step up

image.altText: A beach with heavy erosion during a storm, with a skyline barely visible in the background

props.synopsis: On Friday, millions living in south-east Queensland were told to take shelter. By the next morning, TC Alfred was downgraded to a tropical low. So what happened? How should we assess the warnings, preparation and response?

title.children: ABC News Daily: How we responded to Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: Drone shot of eleven fuel tanks next to harbour

props.synopsis: Leaked correspondence obtained by the ABC shows 11 fuel tanks built to support US military activities in the Indo-Pacific have been unlawfully constructed on Darwin Harbour.

title.children: Huge fuel tanks for US military built unlawfully on Darwin Harbour

image.altText: A yellow freight train going along a track.

props.synopsis: Phosphate was touted as the outback's next big thing, but the high cost of accessing state-owned rail lines has left another mine in financial strife.

title.children: End of the line for outback phosphate mine boom as rail costs bite

image.altText: Five children sit on a fence with a sign that reads 'Devonborough Downs'., wear hats, sky with white clouds, brown earth.

props.synopsis: Families on remote outback stations say they've been left in the lurch after a student boarding house closed suddenly.

title.children: Outback parents scramble to find accommodation after hostel closure

image.altText: Max Jorgensen holds the ball in both hands for the Waratahs.

props.synopsis: The British and Irish Lions series may still be more than four months away, but Max Jorgensen is putting himself in the frame for Wallabies selection, writes Luke Pentony.

title.children: Waratahs young gun may be a certain Wallabies starter against the Lions
